title: Allow two connections tab to merged and so windows splitted horizontally
author: igor2x
body_snippet:
I have been using mRemoteNG for years. Currently I am using mRemoteNG officially stable version 1.76.20 on Windows 10.
    1. Open SSH connection to e.g. Linux computer and do some tasks.
    2. Open new SSH connection to the same remote computer.
  
Now sometimes I would like both windows to bi displayed on the same screen. I have Image editor that has this nice split functionality.

First image:

comments.snippet:
Ahhhhh.... I didn't know this _Panel_ functionality exists. Steps if someone else see this useful:
1. Start session as normal.
2. In the _Connection_ for specific connection change name of _Display | Panel_ from _General_ to something else e.g. _test_.
3. Right click on connection and select _Connect_.
![image](https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/assets/10895030/79d0a039-e62d-4e7b-9a07-1c66519f2265)
4. Now "super" tabs appear _General_ and _test_. Click on _test_ and drag and multiple op...

comments.snippet:
As I said if you set up the connection panels correctly in the connection properties (just give it a name) you should be able to manually start the reconnect with the right click.
The option of reconnecting to resize is not directly named like that, but having a look at the "Appearance" section in the device connection property should give you the elements you're looking for. I suggest you put Resolution "Fit To Panel" and Automatic Resize to "Yes".
